info.title: PMG Asset Fulfillment Platform API
info.description: Multi-tenant asset management and order fulfillment platform API documentation

CompanyHeader.name: X-Company
CompanyHeader.description: Optional company filter for operations API

tags.name: Platform Management
tags.description: Platform configuration and feature flags (Platform Admin only)

tags.name: Warehouse Management
tags.description: Warehouse CRUD operations with multi-tenant support

tags.name: Zone Management
tags.description: Zone CRUD operations within warehouses for company-specific storage areas

tags.name: Collection Management
tags.description: Collection CRUD operations for managing asset collections and collection items

get.description: Retrieves platform information based on the hostname. This endpoint is used to identify which platform a frontend application belongs to before login.

parameters.name: hostname
parameters.description: The hostname of the platform domain

data.description: Returns null if hostname is not found

post.description: Authenticates a user with email and password. Returns user data along with access and refresh tokens. The platform ID is required in the X-Platform header to identify which platform the user belongs to.

is_active.description: Whether the user account is active

access_token.description: JWT access token for API authentication

refresh_token.description: JWT refresh token for obtaining new access tokens

400.description: Bad request - Validation error or missing X-Platform header

403.description: Forbidden - User account is not active

404.description: Not found - User does not exist

post.description:
Logs out the current user by clearing the access_token and refresh_token cookies.
This endpoint does not require authentication as it simply clears the cookies.
Creates a new brand for a company. The platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header. Brand name must be unique within the company.

company_id.description: Company ID that owns this brand

name.description: Brand name (must be unique within the company)

logo_url.description: URL to brand logo (must start with http:// or https://, max 500 characters)

company_id.description: Company ID that owns this brand

400.description: Bad request - Validation error or invalid logo URL

message.example: Invalid logo URL format. Must start with http:// or https:// and be under 500 characters
Only platform administrators can create brands

404.description: Not Found - Company not found or archived

message.example: Company not found or is archived

409.description: Conflict - Brand name already exists for this company

message.example: Brand with name "Nike" already exists for this company

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of brands with their associated company information. Supports filtering by search term, company ID, and active status. Supports sorting by multiple fields. CLIENT role users can only see brands from their own company.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search brands by name (case-insensitive partial match)

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive brands (default shows only active brands)

get.summary: Get a single brand by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific brand including associated company information. CLIENT role users can only view brands from their own company.

404.description: Not Found - Brand not found or user doesn't have access

patch.description: Updates an existing brand's information. Only ADMIN users can update brands. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

name.description: Brand name (must be unique within the company)

logo_url.description: URL to brand logo (must start with http:// or https://)

400.description: Bad request - Validation error or invalid logo URL

message.example: Invalid logo URL format. Must start with http:// or https:// and be under 500 characters
Only platform administrators can update brands

409.description: Conflict - Brand name already exists for this company

message.example: Brand with name "Nike Sports" already exists for this company

delete.description: Deletes (deactivates) a brand by setting its is_active status to false. Only ADMIN users can delete brands. This is a soft delete operation.

message.example: Only platform administrators can delete brands

post.description: Creates a new collection for organizing assets. The platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header. Collection must belong to a company and optionally to a brand.

company_id.description: Company ID that owns this collection

description.example: Standard corporate event package with tables, chairs, and decorations

message.example: Only administrators and logistics staff can create collections

404.description: Not Found - Company or brand not found

message.example: Company not found or is archived

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of collections. Supports filtering by search term, company, brand, category, and active/deleted status. CLIENT role users can only see collections from their own company.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search collections by name (case-insensitive partial match)

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive collections (default shows only active collections)

parameters.name: include_deleted
parameters.description: Include deleted collections (default excludes deleted collections)

get.summary: Get a single collection by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific collection including all its items and asset details. CLIENT role users can only see collections from their own company.

patch.description: Updates an existing collection's information. Only ADMIN and LOGISTICS users can update collections. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

message.example: Only administrators and logistics staff can update collections

404.description: Not Found - Collection or brand not found

delete.description: Soft deletes a collection by setting its deleted_at timestamp. Only ADMIN users can delete collections.

post.summary: Add an item to a collection
post.description: Adds an asset to a collection with specified quantity and display order. Only ADMIN and LOGISTICS users can add items.

asset_id.description: Asset ID to add to the collection

default_quantity.description: Default quantity of this asset in the collection

notes.description: Notes about this item in the collection

404.description: Not Found - Collection or asset not found

409.description: Conflict - Asset already exists in collection

message.example: This asset is already in the collection

patch.description: Updates a collection item's quantity, notes, or display order. Only ADMIN and LOGISTICS users can update items.

default_quantity.description: Default quantity of this asset in the collection

notes.description: Notes about this item in the collection

404.description: Not Found - Collection or item not found

delete.summary: Remove an item from a collection
delete.description: Removes an asset from a collection. Only ADMIN and LOGISTICS users can remove items.

404.description: Not Found - Collection or item not found

get.description: Checks if all items in a collection have sufficient available quantity for an event. Returns detailed availability information for each item.

is_fully_available.description: True if all items have sufficient quantity

is_available.description: True if available quantity >= default quantity

400.description: Bad request - Missing required query parameters

message.example: event_start_date and event_end_date are required in query parameters

post.description: Creates a new company with a vanity subdomain. The platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header. Company domain must be unique within the platform.

domain.description: Company subdomain (lowercase, alphanumeric and hyphens only)

message.example: Domain must be lowercase and contain only alphanumeric characters and hyphens
Only platform administrators can create companies

409.description: Conflict - Domain already exists for this platform

message.example: Company domain already exists for this platform

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of companies for the platform with their associated domains. Supports filtering by search term and sorting. Platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search term to filter companies by name or domain (case-insensitive)

get.summary: Get a single company by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific company including associated domains. Platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header.

patch.description: Updates an existing company's information. Only ADMIN users can update companies. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

domain.description: Company subdomain (lowercase, alphanumeric and hyphens only)

message.example: Only platform administrators can update companies

409.description: Conflict - Domain already exists for this platform

message.example: Company with domain "diageo-updated" already exists for this platform

delete.description: Deletes (soft deletes) a company by setting its deleted_at timestamp. Only ADMIN users can delete companies. This is a soft delete operation.

message.example: Only platform administrators can delete companies

post.description: Creates a new platform instance with configuration and feature flags. This endpoint is restricted to super administrators only.

message.example: Only super administrators can create platforms

post.description: Creates a new user account with role-based access control. The platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header. Email must be unique per platform.

company_id.description: Company ID (required for CLIENT users, null for ADMIN/LOGISTICS)

password.description: User's password (will be hashed before storage)

permissions.description: Array of specific permissions granted to the user

is_active.description: Whether the user account is active

409.description: Conflict - Email already exists for this platform

message.example: Email already exists for this platform

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of users for the platform. Supports filtering by role, status, company, search term, and date range. Requires ADMIN role authentication.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search term to filter users by name or email (case-insensitive)

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Filter by user role (comma-separated for multiple roles)

parameters.name: from_date
parameters.description: Filter users created from this date (ISO 8601 format)

parameters.name: to_date
parameters.description: Filter users created until this date (ISO 8601 format)

post.description: Creates a new warehouse for the platform. The platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header. Warehouse name must be unique within the platform.

name.description: Warehouse name (must be unique within the platform)

message.example: Only platform administrators and logistics staff can create warehouses

409.description: Conflict - Warehouse name already exists for this platform

message.example: Warehouse with name "Dubai Main Warehouse" already exists for this platform

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of warehouses. Supports filtering by search term, country, city, and active status. Supports sorting by multiple fields.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search warehouses by name, country, or city (case-insensitive partial match)

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive warehouses (default shows only active warehouses)

get.summary: Get a single warehouse by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific warehouse.

patch.description: Updates an existing warehouse's information. Only ADMIN and LOGISTICS users can update warehouses. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

name.description: Warehouse name (must be unique within the platform)

address.example: 456 New Industrial Area, Al Quoz, Dubai
456 New Industrial Area, Al Quoz, Dubai

message.example: Only platform administrators and logistics staff can update warehouses

409.description: Conflict - Warehouse name already exists for this platform

message.example: Warehouse with name "Dubai Central Warehouse" already exists for this platform

delete.description: Deletes (deactivates) a warehouse by setting its is_active status to false. Only ADMIN users can delete warehouses. This is a soft delete operation.

message.example: Only platform administrators can delete warehouses

post.description: Creates a new zone within a warehouse for a specific company. The platform ID is automatically extracted from the X-Platform header. Zone name must be unique within the warehouse and company combination.

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse ID where this zone is located

company_id.description: Company ID that owns this zone

name.description: Zone name (must be unique within warehouse and company)

description.example: Premium storage area for fragile items
Premium storage area for fragile items

message.example: Only platform administrators and logistics staff can create zones

404.description: Not Found - Warehouse or company not found

message.example: Warehouse not found or is inactive

409.description: Conflict - Zone name already exists for this warehouse and company

message.example: Zone with name "Zone A1" already exists for this warehouse and company

get.description: Retrieves a paginated list of zones with their associated warehouse and company information. Supports filtering by search term, warehouse ID, company ID, and active status. CLIENT role users can only see zones from their own company.

parameters.name: search_term
parameters.description: Search zones by name (case-insensitive partial match)

parameters.name: include_inactive
parameters.description: Include inactive zones (default shows only active zones)

description.example: Premium storage area for fragile items

get.summary: Get a single zone by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific zone including associated warehouse and company information. CLIENT role users can only view zones from their own company.

description.example: Premium storage area for fragile items

404.description: Not Found - Zone not found or user doesn't have access

patch.description: Updates an existing zone's information. Only ADMIN and LOGISTICS users can update zones. All fields are optional - only provided fields will be updated.

warehouse_id.description: Warehouse ID where this zone is located

company_id.description: Company ID that owns this zone

name.description: Zone name (must be unique within warehouse and company)

message.example: Only platform administrators and logistics staff can update zones

404.description: Not Found - Zone, warehouse, or company not found

409.description: Conflict - Zone name already exists for this warehouse and company

message.example: Zone with name "Zone A2" already exists for this warehouse and company

delete.description: Deletes (deactivates) a zone by setting its is_active status to false. Only ADMIN users can delete zones. This is a soft delete operation.

message.example: Only platform administrators can delete zones
